answers.answer: I have pcos. My doctor seems fine with me being pregnant.  I'm 10+2. I am still taking my thyroid medicine.
I have pcos and have a 3 year old son and a daughter on the way 19+4 pregnant my doctors never said anything about being worried or things of that nature I hope this helps
I also have pcos and I'm 17 weeks tomorrow. My doctors told me I have nothing to worry about

I'm overweight some but I don't think my Dr's are worried about anything because I lost almost 30 lbs before I got pregnant. They were actually wanting me to get pregnant just to see if I could and apparently I still can lol. I also have a 4 year old son.  I was diagnosed a year after I had gotten the mirena iud and had it removed.
I have it and I am pregnant with my 5th child. The only concern my dr ever had was that some woman with PCOS are more prone to gestational diabetes. I had not had it so far though.
Hi guys just found out im 1-2 weeks and so excited..just wondering did ur doc put u on progesterone tablets?

I have pcos and 30 weeks pregnant and plus size so just getting pregnant when having pcos is a blessing dont worry your body is doing good and i had a miscarriage last year and not related to pcos  so just relax and enjoy and congrats!

Thank you everyone who commented. I have so many people (not doctors) saying how hard it is to keep a baby past 1st trimester that it's made me paranoid. :/.It took me and my hubby about 8 months to conceive. :)
My dr didn't put me on progesterone or anything.

I have pcos and found out when I was 15. I was told by many doctors that it will be hard to conceive. My bmi was about 30 before I conceived and my obgynsso I was losing hope of ever getting pregnant. I got off my birth control because I kept forgetting to take them so I needed to start over. In less than a month later I got pregnant. My doctor was so surprised and happy for me that I got pregnant so fast. She didn't have any concerns for me at all. Those doctors that told you about miscarrying because of pcos shouldn't have even said that to you. Don't stress over it and if I were you I would get another doctor

I have PCOS and I'm on baby #4 with no history of miscarriages or pregnancy complications due to having it. I also have RH- blood, a septate uterus, gestational diabetes, and plecenta previa. Still doing good at 33 weeks. Keep a positive attitude :)
I have pcos but have not take medicine for it in quite sometime. I had gastric bypass and everything cleared up and became normal. I am 17w 1d and everything is going great.
I have pcos and this is my fourth baby no miscarriages. It is a little higher rate than no pcos but not much so don't worry. You can always insist you have your progesterone tested.
Try not to worry as easy as that sounds. I have PCOS and I'm now 21 wks :)

I have PCOS and had to take progesterone supplements. With my previous pregnancies when not on the progesterone supplements, I miscarriaged before my first trimester was over. I have been pregnant a total of four times. I've had two miscarriages. 1 live birth with IVF,  I took progesterone until week 10. With this pregnancy,  I was taking metformin for one month and became pregnant. Theyplaced me on progesterone supplements until week 10. Currently, I'm 18 weeks pregnant with no issues.

Thank you everyone for the success stories! Its made me feel MUCH better. i've been so worried so hopefully i'll stop now!I'm going to ask about taking metformin if that will help me at all.Thank you!!!
I have pcos n hypothyroid. I'm 37+4. Have had d most normal pregnancy ever. Ftm though. So it pretty much seems like it doesn't affect u once u r pregnant. Hut u may have to watch ur weight gain. Atb

Hiya - im very worried about miscarrying and askd my doc about progesterone tablets but he said its not common in the uk and there isnt anything out there..could u suggest a name of a brand? Im on metformin till the end of the first trimester

Don't let pcos scare you about getting pregnant. The doctors will keep a close eye on you. I'm 28+6 and in my first trimester I had to use progesterone supplements until I got 12 weeks. You will be fine. My first pregnancy I lost my twins at five months but I didn't let that stop me and now here I am pregnant again with 12 weeks to go until my little boy is born.

question: Does anyone have Polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS)? I'm terrified I'm going to miscarry because of this syndrome. :(  my doctor didn't seem worried because I'm 25 and not grossly overweight. :( but I can't help but worry.
title: Anyone with PCOS?
